intro: Scleranthus bjelagoranus, commonly known as the Balkan thornweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous regions of the Balkans. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are usually pink or red in color. Scleranthus bjelagoranus is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
